Openness.text: I enjoy exploring new ideas and concepts, even if they seem unconventional.
I am fascinated by abstract or theoretical problems in engineering.
I prefer sticking to familiar methods rather than experimenting with new approaches.
I often imagine creative ways to solve technical problems.
I find it exciting to learn about emerging technologies in my field.
I enjoy brainstorming innovative solutions during group projects.
I am uninterested in exploring untested engineering techniques.
I like to challenge conventional approaches to technical problems.
I find theoretical discussions about engineering boring.
I am curious about how new technologies can improve existing systems.

Conscientiousness.text: I always complete my assignments and projects on time.
I pay close attention to details when working on technical tasks.
I tend to procrastinate on important tasks.
I plan my work carefully to ensure high-quality results.
I feel responsible for ensuring my team meets project goals.
I organize my study materials and workspace efficiently.
I often leave tasks unfinished until the last minute.
I double-check my calculations to avoid errors in my work.
I struggle to follow through on long-term project plans.
I take pride in delivering precise and accurate engineering work.

Extraversion.text: I enjoy working in group settings on engineering projects.
I feel energized when presenting my ideas to others.
I prefer working alone rather than in a team.
I am comfortable taking the lead in group discussions or projects.
I find it easy to network with professionals in my field.
I enjoy socializing with classmates during project work.
I feel drained after group meetings or presentations.
I actively participate in class discussions or team brainstorming.
I avoid initiating conversations with new people in my field.
I feel confident speaking up during engineering team meetings.

Agreeableness.text: I enjoy helping my peers solve technical problems.
I try to understand others' perspectives during team conflicts.
I prioritize my own goals over the team's needs.
I am patient when explaining complex engineering concepts to others.
I value maintaining positive relationships with my project teammates.
I willingly compromise to reach team agreements.
I find it hard to empathize with teammates' challenges.
I offer support to struggling team members during projects.
I tend to dominate team discussions rather than collaborate.
I respect differing opinions during engineering group work.

Neuroticism.text: I often feel stressed when facing tight project deadlines.
I remain calm when troubleshooting complex engineering issues.
I worry about making mistakes in my work.
I feel confident in my ability to handle unexpected technical challenges.
I tend to get anxious when presenting my work to others.
I feel overwhelmed when managing multiple engineering tasks.
I stay composed during high-pressure project situations.
I frequently doubt my ability to succeed in engineering challenges.
I handle unexpected setbacks in projects with ease.
I feel nervous when receiving feedback on my work.
